p:
The N2 sorption isotherms of nanocellulose and after loading hematite and zirconia as cellulose@α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 (Figure 4) displayed a typical type IV isotherm denoting the existence of mesopores for pores with diameters in the range 2–50 nm [48]. Figure 4 featured the resulted from the BET surface area and pore volume for nanocellulose and nanocomposite reveal cellulose@α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 a higher BET surface area (852 m2g-1) and pore volume (0.85 cm3g-1) than nanocellulose (720 m2g-1, 0.52 cm3g-1). The pore size of nanocellulose and cellulose@α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 were 24 and 13 nm, respectively, and indicated that composite of α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 had embedded on the pore surface of nanocellulose.Figure 4
N2 sorption isotherms curves of nanocellulose and cellulose@α-Fe2O3–ZrO2.Figure 4
